page.title: 06Puckeridge &Thurlow Hunt
page.content: The kennels which house the hounds of the Puckeridge and Thurlow Hunt have recently been newly built at Wadgell's farm,part of the Thurlow Estate.There are 37 couple of hounds,looked after by the huntsman,Albert Bunch,helped by the whipper-in.The hounds are fed once a day on raw flesh-such as calves which have died on one of the farms,or rabbits, shot by one of the farmers. They also have biscuits.They have to be exercised eachh day and although they have a large grassy run,Mr.Bunch goes off on his bicycle for a couple of hours early in the morning and the hounds follow him. Puppies are named by giving each a name with the same initial as his father.There are twice-weekly hunts during the season,which lasts from October to March.
